transcript.content: This is really annoying. They're going to be... ah no.
He's thinking, he's already done the trampoline, my pogo stick act is never gonna work!
Yeah go on, so there's a hippo waiting, eh- this, this- see it's a great story and I just know he embellishes it or he gets slightly wrong, go on.
So there's a midget jumping up and down...
The midget's loving it, can't believe his luck. Although we think- you think he probably knows he's dicing with danger.
They're all saying "Higher, higher", he gives it one big, like, heavy sort of landing on the trampoline, goes really high. But, goes off at a funny angle...
Yeah? Umm, and sort of flies at-
Ricky bursts out laughing, then Steve
Flies off at a funny angle...
Crowd are clapping, thinking "That's why the hippo was waiting there".
Steve laughs louder, Ricky joins him

But n- nooo, maybe the- there was an accident in a, uhh, a circus with a midget and a hippo eat him, but at no point was this hippo waiting to go on going "Come on", the midget flew off at a hypotenuse, and landed in the hippo's mouth and was swallowed whole!
This is- this is what you embellished- that is great, and what's that-
I have to say though, Rick, when I heard: midget, trampoline, hippot- hippopotamus, I was thinking 'accident waiting to happen'.
It is uh, that- that- that- you should never put those three together.
It's a- it's a recipe for disaster-
Everyone knows that. "Midget, trampoline, hippopotamus? Are you mental?!"
You know when he told me it, he said "And the midget", he didn't mention the hippopotamus, and he said "the midget went higher and higher, and soon he fell off, and the Hippo eat him."
And I said "Sorry? What was the hippo doing there?" He went "It's a circus."
I've never heard of a circus having a hippo?!
What can they do? You can't train them, can you?
You can't have a hippo in a circus! You're not thinking of Zippo?
He did- he- no ye no- an- and- It wasn't, it wasn't, it wasn't some sort of- where Zippo was 'eating a midget' and it's some sort of horrible sexual act?
No it was defin- I heard it on Breakfast, right? And, definitely-
No, it's definitely fact, then, it's definitely truth.
Yeah, okay, right, okay, good. Uhh, let's play a record then.
104.9, I'm Ricky Gervais, uh, with me Stephen Merchant-
Uh, it's the best-of. You've been voting in all week, sending your emails, so here's the clips that you wanted.
We- we- me and Karl went out, right? Um, and uhh, uh with, um, me and Jane and Karl and Johnny and Gigi, wasn't it?
But we're walking down the street. Karl was there though and he can back me up on this. Um, we'd had a curry, we're walking back, and uhh, this little funny homeless fella, didn't he?
He, er- oh I gotta tell it before-fore I go "didn't he?"
It was like, it was like that sort of Slither film where that bloke had loads of tellys watching peoples lives.

So that was going on in my mind and then I was washing up and I picked up the plate and I thought it's amazing innit the human body. The way you can just sort of, you know, "I wanna pick that up" and you do.
And the way your hands work, right, you've got five little digits but it's just the right amount to-
To do what you've gotta do? Right? So so I'm washin-
Ricky interrupts and bursts out laughing

Sorry Karl, stop, "it's just the right amount" might be one of the most genius things I've ever heard said. I would love David Attenborough to phone you up and say "Karl how do i word this, about the evolution of the mammalian front limb?", "well just say it's the right amount"
It is. Of course it is.
One extra would get in the way and one less would make it just that little bit more tricky when picking up a bit of a slippery dish.
So then I was thinking, alright, imagine like going the doctors and they say "yeah everything's alright, your 'earts good and everything but"
Your arts good? What your Lowrys or?
"Your heart, your heart, your in good form and what have you, it's good news, I had Jono in earlier, he's not looking good"
"But you're alright but your hands need to come off"
Right, blimey, that's bad luck. I'd get a second opinion initially.
"But a bit of good news, I've got a nice pair of feet I can sort you out with"
He puts them on, and then I was thinking right first of all: washing up what would that be like?
That would be tricky. And then the second thing was it would probably ruin the sort of shape of your jumper.
Because you'd have to keep putting your feet through there.
And then I thought but I could still cycle in to work-
Well that's what I was thinking, I thought, I could still cycle because I could balance.
And then I thought but the only thing is I probably couldn't pull the brakes.
Because of the little short things.
And then like you I thought but then again you're running in half time. So that's what was going on last night.
That's what I was thinking about.
Well, how long does it take to wash up?
Right, because I imagine you just being there for like, all night.
How long did the little Chinese fella dance for in his pants?
Last night he was at it for like 10 minutes. And his girlfriend never sits in the same room as him, she's always sat in the bedroom-
She's going "you dance in pants again I'm going next door"
Well she was in the bedroom, she's always in the bedroom sat on the floor, on the mobile phone
Yeah, all the time. It's weird how peoples lives are just like, it is like that Groundhog Day thing, it's like, he's jumping about in his underpants, the old woman's sat there reading a book.
And that's what got me thinking about my life-
Are you sure she's not dead?
What is it? Uhh, soandsoso, therewascurtains, she went, "Oh right", said, "You know the thing around the top of the, uh, curtain is a pelmet, not a valence" and he went... cut her off.
Yeah but, my auntie's always making valences on everything, I'll tell you about that next week. Right? Right?
I'm looking forward to that story.
Is this the one that farted for five minutes?
Right, so, we'll talk about that. Uhh, "I was in Texas, I tripped up, I landed on me knees in a puddle." 'W.H.'
We've got Pete, Katherine and Laura in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, their listening online, I assume, and uh...

They're gonna get those great prizes, and remember they've got loads of stuff, they've got, uh, the DVD here, they've got Linda Green, got Stone Roses, they've got another compilation, and Executive Decision.
Where did you read about Brian Blessed? Is it actually true, or have you just libelled someone else-
No it was a- it was an interview, with him in it, talking about it.
Come on! What did he say?!
He said "I c- I climbed Everest and, uh, it played havoc with me belly." Let's talk about it next week.
